CatDescriptText: Mr. William Shanz, student, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 24, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think Pittsburgh Negroes are justified in being angry at the failure of city officials to appoint a Negro as police inspector, in spite of repeated appeals to grant them representation at this level of law enforcement?" Answer reads: "I think they should have one.  They've always treated me all right where I come from."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two young men, including William Shanz on left wearing marbled button down collared shirt and sunglasses, standing in front of RAAB clothes store sign, Wood Street, Downtown
